body_html:
Yeah, as a ./configure option makes sense. We also optionally allow configuration through environment variables with running ./configure, so it can be a hidden option if ./configure gets too large in the future.

We should check for the presence of nasm during ./configure if the user enables it.
body_text:
Yeah, as a ./configure option makes sense. We also optionally allow configuration through environment variables with running ./configure, so it can be a hidden option if ./configure gets too large in the future.
We should check for the presence of nasm during ./configure if the user enables it.
body:
Yeah, as a ./configure option makes sense. We also optionally allow configuration through environment variables with running ./configure, so it can be a hidden option if ./configure gets too large in the future.

We should check for the presence of nasm during ./configure if the user enables it.
